excerpt: 8,650-ft. mountain with road access, a forest preserve at the peak & telescope observatory.
detail_description: Doddabetta Peak, standing at 8,650 feet, offers road access and features a forest preserve at its summit along with a telescope observatory. The property near the peak consists of just 8 well-maintained rooms surrounded by beautiful flora and fauna. Guests can explore nearby tourist attractions such as the tea and chocolate museum and enjoy walks in the adjacent tea gardens. The caretakers are highly praised for their exceptional service, offering assistance with queries, local transport, and sightseeing arrangements.
name: Doddabetta Peak
address: Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Ooty Lake is a must-visit attraction in Ooty, located amidst the picturesque Nilgiris district. This 65-acre artificial lake was established during the British Raj and offers various boating experiences against a stunning backdrop of mountains and eucalyptus trees. Visitors can also explore the nearby thread garden, take a shikara ride, or indulge in adventure camping at the surrounding tea gardens.
name: Ooty Lake
address: West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu

excerpt: Landscaped garden with multiple terraces showcasing thousands of species of roses.
detail_description: The Government Rose Garden, also known as the Centenary Rose Park, is a sprawling paradise for flower enthusiasts located in Ooty, India. Established in 1995 and spanning over 4 hectares, this garden showcases thousands of varieties of roses including hybrid tea roses, floribunda roses, and miniature roses. The beautifully landscaped terraced slopes and pathways make it a prominent tourist attraction in Ooty.
name: Government Rose Garden
address: Rose garden, Davisdale, Bombay Castle, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

excerpt: Landscaped gardens featuring rare trees, a fern house & an Italian-style garden set in 55 acres.
detail_description: The Government Botanical Garden, established in 1897, spans across 55 acres and was designed by the Marquis of Tweedale. The garden boasts well-maintained lawns, rare tree species such as the cork tree and the monkey puzzle tree, an Italian-style garden with a clear pool, and a diverse array of flowering plants. Visitors can also explore the fern house showcasing a wide variety of ferns and orchids.
name: Government Botanical Garden
address: CP96+HH2, Vannarapettai, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

excerpt: Founded in 1830, this church features stained-glass windows & a painting of the Last Supper.
detail_description: C.S.I St. Stephen's Church, established in 1830, is a historic church known for its stunning stained-glass windows and a captivating painting of the Last Supper. The church is a part of various sightseeing tours in Ooty, including the evocative 'Through a Slice of History' tour and the tranquil 'Into the Countryside' excursion.
name: C.S.I St. Stephen's Church
address: CP72+VW7, Road, near Collectors office, Club, Upper Bazar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

excerpt: Tours revealing the manufacturing process that turns fresh leaves into Nilgiri tea, plus tastings.
detail_description: Located in Ooty, Tamil Nadu, The Tea Factory & The Tea Museum offers tours that unveil the intricate process of transforming fresh leaves into Nilgiri tea, followed by tastings. This unique museum takes visitors on a journey through the evolution of tea from its origins to the present day. Adjacent to the museum is a souvenir shop where authentic tea leaves can be purchased. Visitors are given a comprehensive tour of the history and processing of tea, including its various stages before reaching the packed form.
name: The Tea Factory & The Tea Museum
address: Dodabetta Road, Mel Koddapmund, Thalayathimund, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

excerpt: Artificial garden featuring flowers, plants & lawns crafted from thread, canvas & wire.
detail_description: Thread Garden in Ooty, also known as Udagamandalam, is a must-visit attraction that showcases an extraordinary collection of artificial flowers and plants meticulously crafted from thread, canvas, and wire. This unique garden features around 150 species of lifelike flora created using a technique called four-dimensional hand-wound embroidery. The skilled artists have utilized approximately 6 crore meters of embroidery thread to bring this captivating display to life.
name: Thread Garden
address: CM4Q+Q86, N Lake Rd, opp. Boat House, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Wax World is a unique museum located just two kilometers from the main town of Ooty. Housed in a 130-year-old Colonial Mansion, it offers an entirely different ambiance for tourists to explore. The museum showcases handicrafts and products made by indigenous communities, including bee honey, bee wax, and hand-crafted artifacts. Additionally, visitors can find gourmet cheeses from Acres Wild Cheesemaking Farmstay in Coonoor.
name: Wax World
address: Vannarapettai, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

excerpt: 118-ft. dam impounding the Sandhyanallah reservoir popular for fishing, picnicking & movie filming.
detail_description: Kamaraj Sagar Dam, located in Ooty, is a picturesque spot surrounded by lush hills and misty valleys. The 118-ft. dam creates the Sandhyanallah reservoir, which is known for fishing and picnicking. It's also a popular filming location due to its scenic beauty. Visitors often come here with family and friends to enjoy picnics and capture memorable moments amidst the stunning natural backdrop.
name: Kamaraj Sagar Dam
address: Sholur, Tamil Nadu 643005

excerpt: Ooty (short for Udhagamandalam) is a resort town in the Western Ghats mountains, in southern India's Tamil Nadu state. Founded as a British Raj summer resort, it retains a working steam railway line. Other reminders of its colonial past include Stone House, a 19th-century residence, and the circa-1829 St. Stephen’s Church. Its 55-acre Government Botanical Garden lies on the slopes of Doddabetta Peak.
detail_description: Ooty, also known as Udhagamandalam, is a charming resort town nestled in the Western Ghats mountains of Tamil Nadu, India. This picturesque destination was once a favored summer retreat during the British Raj era and still showcases remnants of its colonial history, such as the historic Stone House and St. Stephen’s Church. Visitors can explore the 55-acre Government Botanical Garden situated on the slopes of Doddabetta Peak and take a ride on the working steam railway line.
name: Ooty
address: Tamil Nadu, India

detail_description: Established in 1848, Ooty Botanical Gardens is situated on the slopes of Doddabetta peak. Spanning 22 hectares, this terraced garden is managed by the Tamil Nadu Horticultural Society. It's best to visit during non-monsoon seasons to fully enjoy its beauty and diverse plant life.
name: Ooty Botanical Gardens
address: CP75+57W, botanical, Garden Rd, Davisdale, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

excerpt: Views across tea fields, grassy plains & hillside vistas of wildflowers, with rustic lodges nearby.
detail_description: Ketti Valley View Point is a scenic spot located in the Ketti valley, in the Nilgiris district of Tamil Nadu, India. The view from the viewpoint overlooks rolling hills, wildflowers, and rustic lodges nearby.
name: Ketti Valley View Point
address: 9PQG+H24, Nagapattinam - Coimbatore - Gundlupet Hwy, Thalayathimund, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Located in Ooty, the Stone House is the first bungalow built in the area, dating back to 1822. Originally known as Kal Bungalow by locals, it was constructed by John Sullivan on land purchased from the Toda people. The property offers tidy accommodations with good views of the lake and hills. It's conveniently situated just a short walk from both the train station and bus stop, making it easily accessible for travelers.
name: Stone House
address: Stone House Area, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque hill station of Ooty, the Murugan Temple, Elk Hill is a serene and spiritual destination. The temple features a magnificent 40-foot golden statue of Lord Murugan, reminiscent of the one in Kuala Lumpur. Set amidst lush pine and eucalyptus forests, this tranquil spot offers visitors a peaceful retreat to seek blessings and capture stunning photographs.
name: Murugan Temple, Elk Hill
address: 9PX5+PW3, Nondimedu, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

excerpt: Kid-oriented amusement park with a dinosaur attraction & an indoor snow room, plus a food court.
detail_description: Thunder World, also known as Dinosaur Park, is a themed amusement park located in Ooty, Tamil Nadu. It features the popular Jurassic Jungle with lifelike models of dinosaurs and other attractions like the Haunted House and Vortex ride. The park uses multi-dimensional projection technology to create illusions that reconstruct the age of dinosaurs. With sections such as World of Spirits and Vortex, visitors can enjoy 3D paintings with scary effects.
name: Thunder World
address: N Lake Rd, near Boat House, Mani Vihar, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Avalanche Chocolate Factory is located in the picturesque region of Ooty, known for its stunning Avalanche Lake and Sanctuary. The area is also home to the famous Avalanche Dam, which is sometimes referred to as Canada Dam due to Canadian funding. The factory offers a wide range of high-quality products including chocolates, original eucalyptus oil, branded teas and flavor teas, sleepers, Woodies, jackets, sweaters, toys for kids and football gear.
name: Avalanche Chocolate Factory
address: CM4P+MVC, N Lake Rd, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Ooty, the Government Rose Garden is a breathtaking expanse that spans 10 acres and showcases an impressive collection of over 20,000 rose varieties. Established in 1995, this vibrant garden is a true feast for the senses, with its meticulously curated rose beds bursting with color and delightful fragrances. Visitors can also enjoy beautifully manicured lawns and charming fountains that enhance the serene atmosphere.
name: Rose garden
address: CM6W+32M, Kandal, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden, nestled near Ooty's Thread Garden and Rose garden, is a breathtaking oasis maintained by Karnataka's Horticulture department. Surrounded by the Nilgiri hills, it offers a serene retreat into nature. The garden boasts 50,000 pots of diverse and stunning flowers and features various attractions such as the tea garden, topiary garden, flower beds, sunken garden, and more.
name: Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden
address: CM2M+9GV, Fern Hill, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

excerpt: Large, scenic lake popular for paddleboating, rowing & other activities in & out of the water.
detail_description: Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House in Ooty is a popular destination for tourists, offering activities such as paddleboating and rowing on a scenic lake. The area also features the Doddabetta Peak, Government Rose Garden, Nilgiri Mountain Railway Line, and other attractions. Built by John Sullivan, the boat house provides a serene environment surrounded by eucalyptus trees. Nearby, visitors can explore the Mini Garden with its amusement park and toy train for children.
name: Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House, Ooty
address: N Lake Rd, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Cairn Hill Reserve Forest is a serene eco-tourism site located in the hill town of Ooty. It boasts one of the oldest and largest Cyprus plantations in the Nilgiris, offering a tranquil stay amidst its natural beauty. The reserve is home to various bird and animal species such as nilgiri monkeys, giant squirrels, and bison.
name: Cairn Hill Reserve Forest
address: Tamil Nadu

detail_description: The Toy Train Ticket Counter, also known as the Nilgiri Mountain Railway Toy Train, is a popular attraction in Ooty. Established in 1899, it offers breathtaking views of forests, tunnels, slopes, fog, and birds. The train ride from Ooty to Coonoor spans approximately 20 kilometers and takes about 1.5 hours. Tickets can be booked online or through apps like Paytm and are available for different classes at varying prices.
name: Toy Train Ticket Counter
address: CM4W+4FH, Upper Bazar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: The Honeymoon Boat House is a serene and romantic destination located near the Ooty Boat House. It offers a quieter and more intimate atmosphere, making it perfect for couples seeking a peaceful boat ride experience. Visitors can choose from pedal boats, rowboats, and motorboats, but the highlight is the Kashmir-inspired Shikaras. This spot has gained popularity since its establishment in 2004 and is ideal for anyone looking to enjoy a memorable boat ride reminiscent of Kashmiri shikaras.
name: Honeymoon Boat House
address: Lake Rd, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

detail_description: Nestled between Ooty and Thalakunda, the Pine Forest in Ooty is a picturesque destination that offers breathtaking views of the Nilgiri hills. This popular tourist spot has been featured in numerous films and is a favorite among nature lovers. The orderly arrangement of tall pine trees creates a mesmerizing scenic canvas that attracts visitors of all ages. Walking through the forest trails provides a serene escape from city life, with the added charm of a beautiful lake within its vicinity.
name: Pine Forest Ooty
address: CMR5+2V, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643005, India

detail_description: Pykara mountain is located in the northern region and then turns westward after reaching the edge of the plateau. The mountain features a majestic series of cascades, with the last two falls measuring 55m and 61m in height, known as Pykara falls. It's a beautiful destination worth visiting for nature enthusiasts.
name: Pykara mountain
address: CM6W+32M, Kandal, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: The Nilgiri District private Library, established in 1859, is a treasure trove of rare books and documents that offer a glimpse into the history of the Nilgiris and its hill tribes. The library's collection of around 30,000 books includes biographies, old books, and 19th-century British journals. Housed in an iconic Gothic building with brick red color and white details, the library stands as a testament to the 19th century.
name: Nilgiri District private Library
address: CP63+747, Hospital Rd, Upper Bazar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Deer Park in Ooty is a delightful spot for observing gentle deer in their natural surroundings. Situated near the picturesque Ooty Lake, this park is a favorite among wildlife enthusiasts. It's just 2 km away from the lake and easily accessible by road. The park boasts a diverse range of fauna, including Sambhar and Chithal deer species, making it an intriguing visit for nature lovers.
name: Deer Park
address: CM3Q+6WV, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

detail_description: The Toy Train Railway Station Ooty is a popular attraction for tourists visiting the area. The Nilgiri Mountain Railway, also known as the Toy Train, operates between Mettupalayam and Ooty on a daily basis. This heritage train covers a distance of 26 km, passing through 208 curves, 16 tunnels, and 250 bridges during its scenic journey.
name: Toy Train Railway Station Ooty
address: CM3W+X9G, Toy Train Railway Station, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

excerpt: Small museum featuring exhibits on cultural history as well as zoology, botany & archaeology.
detail_description: Nestled near the picturesque Ooty Botanical Gardens, the Government Museum is a delightful gem that invites visitors to explore the vibrant cultural and natural heritage of the Nilgiri region. Established in 1989, this charming museum serves as a window into local history, showcasing an impressive array of tribal artifacts, archaeological treasures, and exhibits dedicated to the area's unique flora and fauna.
name: Government Museum
address: Kotagiri Rd, near Arts College, Stone House, Stone House Area, Kil Kodappamund, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

excerpt: Peaceful 21-hole golf course with serene, rolling greens  & some tree shaded areas.
detail_description: The Ooty Golf Course is a serene 21-hole golf course located on the rolling Wenlock Downs, around 7000ft above sea level. Managed by the Gymkhana Club in Ooty, it spans across 193.56 acres and offers picturesque views of Ooty from the highest point in the Nilgiri Hills. Surrounded by reserved forest area, this prominent golf destination provides a peaceful retreat for both members and tourists alike.
name: Ooty Golf Course
address: CM99+W63, Golf Course Road, Finger Post, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

excerpt: Tranquil Catholic church known for its enshrined cross, airy, colorful sanctuary & yearly feast.
detail_description: Kandal Cross Shrine, also known as the Calvary of Tamil Nadu, is a Roman Catholic church located near Udhagamandalam Railway Station. It is believed to house a relic of the true cross and is considered a powerful place where wishes come true. The shrine, founded in 1933 by French priest Paul Crayssac, is popular for its tranquil atmosphere and colorful sanctuary.
name: Kandal Cross Shrine
address: CM5F+9PR, Kasturibai Colony, Kandal, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

detail_description: Arulmigu Sri Erattai Mariamman Temple in Ooty is a popular destination, especially during the car festival when it gets crowded with dancing and festivities. Parking can be a challenge, so it's advisable to find a spot near Lower Bazaar or the bus stand. Despite the crowds, visiting during non-festival times allows for peaceful prayer and reflection inside the temple. The temple is revered for its powerful goddess and offers a serene atmosphere in the cold climate of Ooty.
name: Arulmigu Sri Mariamman Temple Ooty
address: Mariyamman temple road, opp. market, Upper Bazar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: The Ooty Toy Train Tourist Park, also known as the Nilgiri Mountain Railway, offers a unique and unforgettable experience for visitors to Ooty. This historical train ride from Mettupalayam to Ooty via Coonoor is a must-do activity when in the area. The train features both first class and second class seating options, with first class offering more comfort and fewer seats.
name: Ooty Toy Train Tourist Park
address: Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Shooting Point in Ooty offers a picturesque setting with endless green meadows and mist-covered rolling hills, creating a fairy-tale-like ambiance. The location is perfect for recreating iconic movie scenes or capturing stunning photographs. Visitors can enjoy horse rides at affordable rates and are advised to dress warmly due to the cold, heavy winds at the hilltop. With an entry ticket of 30, this beautiful spot provides breathtaking views and ample photo opportunities amidst its lovely hills.
name: SHOOTING POINT
address: CP2P+96R, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: The Radio Astronomy Centre, a part of the National Center for Radio Astrophysics and funded by the Department of Atomic Energy, is a dedicated research and training facility. Established by the Ratan Tata Basic Research Centre, it houses physicists, mathematicians, and statisticians. The center is home to India's first-ever radio telescope and offers an enriching experience for visitors. It hosted a memorable solar eclipse viewing event in 2019 with scientists explaining phenomena to students and other interested visitors.
name: Radio Astronomy Centre
address: Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, National Centre for Radio Astrophysics, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643004, India

detail_description: Wax Planet is a popular wax museum located inside the Ice Thunder campus in Ooty. It features lifelike wax models of famous personalities such as Gandhi Ji, Obama, Johnny Depp, and even offers the opportunity to play KBC with Amitabh Bachchan and meet Iron Man. Visitors praise the realistic detailing of the models, particularly noting the attention-grabbing eyes and impressive skin detailing.
name: Wax Planet
address: Thunder World, N Lake Rd, Mani Vihar, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Hindustan Photo Films Mfg.Co.Ltd, a once highly esteemed photo manufacturing company in India, has permanently closed its doors. With a workforce of about 5000 employees, it was the first company to develop photo films and gained fame during the black and white era. However, due to digitalization, the company struggled to adapt and ultimately ceased operations. This central government-owned establishment holds nostalgic value for many as it was renowned for producing INDU Films.
name: Hindustan Photo Films Mfg.Co.Ltd
address: CMJ9+V9V, Indunagar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643005, India

detail_description: Shooting Spot | Pine Forest is a must-visit destination in Ooty, offering a magical forest experience with towering pine trees and breathtaking views. The location is perfect for nature lovers, providing an opportunity to enjoy the scenery next to the river and experience slight drizzling at the top of the mountain. Visitors can also opt for horse rides around the lake. However, some challenges include slippery pathways due to rain and soil erosion, as well as a lack of proper maintenance.
name: Shooting Spot | Pine Forest
address: CMR5+4RG, Nagapattinam - Coimbatore - Gundlupet Hwy, Tamil Nadu 643005, India

name: Chocolate Museum
address: Indunagar, Ootacamund, Nilgiris NH-67, Coimbatore Ooty Pykara Gudalur Highway, Ooty, 643001, India

detail_description: Located in a 130-year-old ancient manor in Ooty, the Wax Museum is a must-visit tourist attraction. The museum features life-sized wax statues of prominent personalities such as Mahatma Gandhi, Mother Teresa, and A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, as well as replicas of traditional Indian villages and rural landscapes. Visitors can also explore other attractions in Ooty like Kotagiri trekking and a jeep safari at Nilgiri Reserve.
name: Wax Museum & Chocolate Market
address: CP88+Q8V, Vannarapettai, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Resource Centre For Tribal Development (HADP) in Ooty is a well-maintained museum showcasing prehistoric artifacts and providing insights into the social, cultural, economic, and religious activities of tribal communities in South India and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The center also conducts extensive research on tribal lifestyles, habits, and living conditions. Additionally, it offers a wide range of handcrafted products for sale from various regions across India.
name: Resource Centre For Tribal Development (HADP)
address: CP85+3PW, Pudumund, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Ketti Valley View, located in Ooty, is a popular vantage point offering a breathtaking panoramic view of the largest valley in the Nilgiris. The hilltop features a telescope room that provides 360-degree views of the mesmerizing landscape, making it one of the most exciting activities in Ooty. Ketti Valley is often referred to as the 'Switzerland of South India' and is home to a small village near Coonoor.
name: Ketti Valley View
address: 9PP6+JJM, Ketty, Tamil Nadu 643003, India

detail_description: Nestled on the picturesque Dodabetta Ridge, Raj Bhavan Udhagamandalam is a stunning historical mansion that dates back to 1877. Constructed under the watchful eye of the Duke of Buckingham during his tenure as Governor of Madras, this cream-colored edifice spans an impressive 87 acres and offers breathtaking views overlooking the nearby Botanical Gardens.
name: Raj Bhavan Udhagamandalam
address: CPC6+P7R, Vannarapettai, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: Elk Hill is surrounded by some of the best budget hotels and service apartments in Ooty. These accommodations are conveniently located near Central Ooty, the Botanical Garden, Kandal, Fern Hill, and Pudumund. Staying in this area provides easy access to the attractions and natural beauty of Ooty while offering comfortable and affordable lodging options for travelers.
name: Elk Hill
address: Ooty, Tamil Nadu, India

name: Tea Park
address: CP6P+W93, Battarkambai, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Tea Estate Ooty, located in the village of Glenmorgan, about 25 km from Ooty, is one of the oldest and most charming tea estates in the region. Visitors can immerse themselves in the entire tea-making process, from plucking to packaging, and learn about the various types of tea grown on the estate. The sweet aroma of fresh tea leaves adds to the experience. The estate also features a gift shop where visitors can purchase some of these fascinating varieties.
name: Tea Estate Ooty
address: 9MQV+WPP, Lovedale Rd, Fern Hill, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643004, India

detail_description: Lamb's Rock Tea Garden View Point, situated 8 km from Gudalur, offers a stunning and peaceful experience. The area is ideal for trekking and provides breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and forests. Visitors can enjoy shopping at nearby shops and savoring local snacks. Although ticket prices are relatively high, the opportunity to explore the tea garden and capture memorable photos makes it worthwhile.
name: Lamb's Rock Tea Garden View Point
address: CM6V+CV8, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

detail_description: The Mini Car Museum in Ooty is a paradise for car enthusiasts, boasting an extensive collection of over 1000 miniature car models. From Lamborghinis to Jaguars and Porsches to Ferraris, the museum showcases a diverse range of automobiles sourced from various places. Visitors are drawn to this unique attraction, spending hours admiring the impressive display. It's considered a must-visit destination in Ooty and has been described as both beautiful and informative by many visitors.
name: Mini Car Museum
address: CP66+6F7, Stone House, Stone House Area, Thalayathimund, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

detail_description: Kamarajar Sagar Dam, located on the Bhavani River in Tamil Nadu, India, is a versatile structure built between 1956 and 1964. It serves various purposes such as irrigation, drinking water supply, hydroelectric power generation, and flood control. The dam's reservoir, known as Lower Bhavani Reservoir, offers recreational activities like boating, fishing, and birdwatching against a backdrop of lush greenery.
name: Kamarajar dam
address: Kamaraj Sagar Dam, Sholur, Tamil Nadu 643005, India

name: Pine forest Theetukal
address: CM39+G8, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643004, India

detail_description: The Mariamman Temple is a vibrant and colorful Hindu temple located in the heart of the city. The temple is dedicated to the goddess Mariamman, known for her power to cure illnesses and diseases. Visitors can admire the stunning architecture adorned with intricate carvings of various deities and mythical creatures. The temple is a popular destination for both worshippers and tourists seeking to experience the rich cultural heritage of Hinduism.
name: Mariamman Temple
address: 9MH8+79P, Kilkavatty, Muthorai, Tamil Nadu 643004, India
